issues.description: The framework's 'Theoretical Foundations' section does not include specific citations to academic literature or prior research. The Framework v10.0 specification requires citations to support the framework's theoretical grounding.
issues.impact: While this does not prevent execution, it reduces the scholarly validity and reproducibility of the framework as a research artifact.
issues.fix: In the human-readable part of the framework specification, update the 'Theoretical Foundations' section to include references to the sentiment analysis theory upon which it is based.

issues.description: The corpus contains only two documents (N=2). This sample size is suitable for the stated goals of pipeline validation and comparative case analysis, but it is insufficient for any form of inferential statistical analysis (e.g., t-tests, ANOVA).
issues.impact: Analysis will be limited to descriptive and qualitative comparisons. The results cannot be used to make statistically significant claims or generalizations.
issues.fix: No fix is required as the experiment's goal is pipeline validation. If inferential statistical analysis were desired, the corpus size would need to be increased significantly (e.g., N>=10 for descriptive statistics, N>=30 for robust inferential tests).
